description.narrative: The intended outcome of the intervention is to provide a platform for future engagement in area of waste management in BIH, including plan for both physical investment and identified areas for institutional support. It also aims to improve sustainability of the current solid waste management practices in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The Project aims to support BiH to effectively bridge the transition from the current status of SWM to a more integrated sector in alignment with EU Directives, supporting BIH on the road to EU accession.

Sveriges ambassad har fått en ansökan från Världsbanken (VB) om stöd med 17 940 000 kronor för att genomföra " långsiktig hållbarhet för integrerad avfallhantering " i Bosnien och Hercegovina (BIH) under perioden 2016-2018. Insatserna syftar till att förbättra avfallhantering i landet, genom 1) att genomföra avfallhanteringsprojketet (SWM) och informera om rekommendationer för integrerad nationell strategi och fortsatt dialog inom sektorn; 2) att genomföra utvalda evenemang samt informera och driva samhällsengagemang och nå ut till allmänheten med information; 3) utföra utvalda utbildningar som riktas mot prioriterade kunskapsområden inom sektorn och 4) Ta fram ca 1-3 prioriterade investeringar.
Under "Fas 1" handlar insatserna om långsiktiga sektorverksamhet som fokuserar på prioriterade aktiviteter med syftet att stödja Bosnien och Hercegovina att överbrygga från den nuvarande statusen av avfallshantering till en mer integrerad sektor i linje med EU: s direktiv. Kommande och mer utvecklade faser förväntas följa efter fas 1. Total budget av insatserna är 17 940 000 SEK, uppdelade i två faser, Fas 1 med 10 760 000 SEK, och Fas 2 med 7 180 000 SEK. Aktiviteter i Fas 2 kommer att fastställas först efter avslutad granskning av SWM sektorn under 2017 (projektdelen 1) och föreslagna rekommendationer. De föreslagna aktiviteterna för Fas 2 och allokerade medel kommer bedömas och beslutas av ambassadens efter fas 1. SEK 460 000 är planerade som en separat komponent för teknisk rådgivning och uppföljning under hela genomförande. Det totala insats värde är 18 400 000 SEK.

World Bank has applied to Embassy of Sweden for funding of 17 940 000 SEK to carry out the " Building Long-term Sustainability for Integrated Solid Waste Management " in Bosnia and Herzegovina (BIH) during the period 2017-2018. The intervention aims at improving the Solid Waste Management sector in BIH, by 1) carrying out Solid Waste Management (SWM) sector Review to inform recommendations for integrated national approach and future sector dialogue and engagement; 2) implementing selected awareness events to kick start civic engagement and outreach to the general public, 3) delivery of selected workshops/training events targeting priority areas of knowledge gap in the sector and 4) Assessment of 1-3 priority investments and pilots. Overall, the intervention represents “Phase 1” of a long-term sector engagement that focuses on priority activities aimed to support BiH to effectively bridge the transition from the current status of SWM to a more integrated sector in alignment with EU Directives. Subsequent and more mature phases are expected to follow building on Phase 1. The intervention’s total budget is 17 940 000 SEK, divided into two phases, Phase 1 10 760 000SEK, and phase 2 7 180 000SEK. Activities in Phase 2 will be defined only after completion of SWM sector review (project component 1) in 2017 and its recommendations. Proposed activities in Phase 2 and second tranche will be subject to Embassy’s approval in 2017. In addition to that, 460 000 SEK has been planned within the separate component to enable technical advice and monitoring during the project implementation. This makes total contribution’s value 18,4 MSEK.

participating-org.narrative: IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank

tag.narrative: 11.b - By 2020, substantially increase the number of cities and human settlements adopting and implementing integrated policies and plans towards inclusion, resource efficiency, mitigation and adaptation to climate change, resilience to disasters, and develop and implement, in line with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015–2030, holistic disaster risk management at all levels.

11.b - Till 2020 väsentligen öka det antal städer och samhällen som antar och genomför integrerade strategier och planer för inkludering, resurseffektivitet, begränsning av och anpassning till klimatförändringarna och motståndskraft mot katastrofer samt utveckla och genomföra, i linje med Sendai-ramverket för katastrofriskreducering 2015–2030, en samlad katastrofriskhantering på alla nivåer.
3.9 - By 2030, substantially reduce the number of deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and air, water and soil pollution and contamination.
3.9 - Till 2030 väsentligt minska antalet döds- och sjukdomsfall till följd av skadliga kemikalier samt föroreningar och kontaminering av luft, vatten och mark.

description.narrative: The project delivered a number of results, mostly in accordance with works plan or with slight delays, as follow: The SWM countrywide Assessment and Sector Investment Plan have been duly completed. The document has been used as a ground for preparation other strategic documents in sector of Environment, whilst Brcko district used results from assessment in planning waste management in BD, including planning transfer stations and organizing transport of waste. Most of TA and Capacity Development activities have been successfully implemented and finalized, such as number of workshops on leachate treatment, landfill gas management, landfill operations, practical in-field landfill operations; The landfill-specific” technical assistance components and technical documentation, particularly in Sarajevo and Mostar; technical study tours to a landfill in Zenica landfill in BiH and AWV Hartberg in Austria, etc Technical assistance is being provided to the respective ministries following areas of interest expressed by them. The guidelines on tariff setting methodology for collection and disposal have been developed as well. The Extended Producer`s responsibility EPR report is completed and distributed to concerned parties including entity Ministries of environment, Brcko district and MOFTER. Communication strategy has been developed and shared with Ministries for their comments. This component has not been visible as it was expected. The issue have been discussed with World Bank many times. Pre-feasibility studies for 7 locations in BIH duly finalised and delivered to respective authorities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
